author: nishant0
content:
Since you are wrapping the whole message, then it makes sense to only focus on the message rather than the amount of signatures. 
> Also I assume those are the lower boundary numbers, as at some circumstances multiple messages can be received (i.e multiple block proposals, etc).
Multiple block proposals can only happen if there are either some deep forks happening or a malicious proposer ends up proposing 2 blocks in a slot, so it is pretty unlikely to happen.
 
However the main factor that influences the expected message rate would be the current active validator count as that affects number of committees, number of validators per subnet, etc. So if you have the validator count growing, this will lead to the message rates in the aggregate and attestation subnet topic also growing. 

> Regarding optimisations during verification I assume those computations can be parallelised to some extent, but will research this further and how each client is handling this. 
Yeap, all clients as far as I am aware do batched signature verification. This allows multiple messages  to be verified with a single final exponentiation .
